title: Ticket #1788: Opening /dev/null for write with O_CREATE fails on solaris 11
description:
On x86-64 Solaris 11, attempts to open /dev/null for writing with O_CREAT via safe_open_wrapper() fails with errno 6 (ENXIO). This is because safe_open_wrapper() first tries to open the file with O_EXCL and bombs out if that fails with an error other than EEXIST. On Solaris 11, the open returns ENXIO instead.

On Solaris, /dev/null is a sym-link to /devices/pseudo/mm@0:null, a character special file. Attempts to open the character special file with O_EXCL work as expected (fail with EEXIST). Attempts to open a file that sym-links to the character special file with O_EXCL work as expected (fail with EEXIST). But on Solaris 11, opening /dev/null with O_EXCL fails with ENXIO. This goes against the man-page for open(), which says opening a sym-link with O_EXCL always fails with EEXIST.

This came up in the test suite, where the Condor-C test jobs have their stdout and stderr set to /dev/null.
